title: U.S. Government to Take Cut of Nvidia and AMD A.I. Chip Sales to China
summary: In a highly unusual arrangement with President Trump, the companies are expected to kick 15 percent of what they make in China to the U.S. government.

title: Trump’s Cartel Order Revives ‘Bitter’ Memories in Latin America
summary: The decision triggers fears that the U.S. might return to a pattern of military interference in the region that dates to the Monroe Doctrine.

title: Trump Administration to Put F.B.I. Agents on Night Patrol in Washington
summary: The move is part of President Trump’s pledge to crack down on street crime in the nation’s capital.

title: Vance Says U.S. Is Working for a Meeting With Trump, Putin and Zelensky
summary: The vice president said the White House was trying to determine “when these three leaders could sit down and discuss an end to this conflict.”

title: Trump and Putin May Get a Cold Reception From Some Alaskans
summary: Warm relations between Alaskans and Russians began to shift with the rise of Vladimir Putin and the invasion of Ukraine. In Alaska, feelings on the two leaders’ meeting seemed mixed.

title: Israeli Strike Kills 4 Al Jazeera Journalists, Network Says
summary: Anas al-Sharif, a well-known correspondent, was among those killed. Israel said it had targeted Mr. al-Sharif, claiming he worked for Hamas, which he had denied.

title: Netanyahu Doubles Down on Gaza Offensive After Global Backlash
summary: This is not the first time the Israeli prime minister has called for one final military drive to dismantle Hamas and end the war.

title: Trump Attacked California’s Redistricting System. Republicans Want to Save It.
summary: The independent body that redraws the state’s political maps isn’t perfect, many Republicans say. But they prefer that to the gerrymander that Gov. Gavin Newsom seeks to offset one proposed in Texas.

title: ‘Fighting Fire With Fire,’ Democrats on Defense as Texas Redistricting Looms
summary: A Republican proposal to add five Republican congressional seats in Texas imperils Democrats’ midterm prospects.

title: Trump Raids Help Stir a Political Reversal for Karen Bass
summary: The mayor of Los Angeles has emerged as a leading voice of the city’s resistance to the Trump administration after facing criticism for her handling of the wildfires.

title: Senator Gallego Brings a Message of Hope for Democrats to Iowa
summary: Senator Ruben Gallego of Arizona won his seat last year by outperforming national Democrats among Hispanic voters and men. He wants the party to listen to his message as it regroups.

title: Alyson Stoner, a Former Disney Star, Writes a Tell-All. Sort Of.
summary: Alyson Stoner has much to say about their years acting for Disney and Nickelodeon. They’re careful how they say it.

title: What Happened When Mark Zuckerberg Moved In Next Door
summary: The billionaire has bought at least 11 properties in Palo Alto, Calif., creating a compound for his family, a private school for his children — and headaches for his neighbors.

title: In India, Immigration Raids Detain Thousands and Create a Climate of Fear
summary: Officials have picked up people across the country, most of them Muslim, citing a national security risk. Rights groups say the raids are targeting detainees’ religion and language.

title: Book Blacklist in Kashmir Aims to Muzzle Criticism of India
summary: The federally appointed government in the contested region has declared 25 books off limits, part of what many see as a pattern of repression.

title: Bears Are Terrorizing Romania. It’s Humans’ Fault.
summary: Romania’s growing bear population has turned conservation into confrontation for people living in the shadows of the Carpathian Mountains.

title: Spain Is Going Its Own Way
summary: The government’s humane and pragmatic approach to immigration is an example for others to emulate.

title: ‘Profound and Abiding Rage’: Canada’s Answer to America’s Abandonment
summary: America’s withdrawal from the global order is forcing former allies to rethink their identities.

title: China’s Automakers Are Taking a Shortcut to European Markets
summary: Ships carrying Chinese cars are using the Red Sea and Suez Canal even as other vessels still sail around Africa in fear of attacks by the Houthi militia.

title: AOL Will Shut Its Dial-Up Internet Service (Yes, It’s Still Operating)
summary: The company said the service, synonymous with the early days of the internet, will be discontinued on Sept. 30.

title: Heavy Rains in Wisconsin Lead to Flooding and Early Closure of State Fair
summary: Record-setting rainfall caused intense flooding in and around the Milwaukee area starting on Saturday night.

title: Terry Reid, Rock Singer Known as ‘Superlungs,’ Dies at 75
summary: He missed his chance to be Led Zeppelin’s lead vocalist, but his solo work — and his otherworldly voice — drew raves from Aretha Franklin and others.
